author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Lady Gaga to perform with Metallica at Grammys
text:
Music's biggest night has plenty of artists set to steal the show.
Lady Gaga wowed at the Super Bowl last weekend and she may have something even bigger in store for the Grammys Sunday night.
The pop star will take the stage on Sunday with rock group Metallica — but what they will perform together is still under wraps.
Gaga — who is no stranger to showing off her wild side — is reportedly a big fan of the band and jumped on board with the idea after Metallica drummer Lars Ulrich suggested it, Grammy producer Ken Ehrlich told ABC Radio.
Tony Award-winner and Carpool Karaoke king James Corden is the evening’s host — but don’t expect him to sing.
“There are a lot of brilliant singers there,” he told the Associated Press, “and no one needs to hear me disrupt such beautiful vocals.”
From left, James Hetfield, Kirk Hammett, Lars Ulrich and Robert Trujillo of Metallica are slated to take the stage with Lady Gaga. (Metallica/Getty Images) So while some fan favorites like Kanye West, Drake, Taylor Swift and Justin Bieber are all reportedly not attending, there will be plenty of big names on hand.
Powerhouse vocalist Adele, who is up against Beyoncé in four Grammy categories, will take the stage, and Queen Bey herself is rumored to be giving a low-key performance now that she’s pregnant with twins, according to various sources.
There’s no Kanye — but expect to see one of his talented protégés, Chance the Rapper, who is up for a total of seven awards, as well as famed duo Daft Punk alongside The Weeknd after they debuted their song “I Feel it Coming” in November.
Katy Perry, Bruno Mars, Alicia Keys, Maren Morris, Sturgill Simpson, Lukas Graham, Anderson Paak and A Tribe Called Quest are slated to perform.
Newcomer Kelsea Ballerini and Grammy vets Keith Urban and Carrie Underwood will also sing a tune or two.
Gaga is reportedly a huge fan of the iconic metal band. (Darron Cummings/AP) The Recording Academy also rounded up several famous artists to pay tribute to others.
Demi Lovato will join Little Big Town, Andra Day and Tori Kelly to commemorate the Bee Gees, while John Legend and Cynthia Erivo will memorialize musicians who have died in the last year. Specific tribute segments are set for Prince and George Michael.
“Each possessed a distinct style and sound,” said Academy president and CEO Neil Portnow last week. “They were both adored by audiences worldwide.”
The Grammy Awards air on CBS at 8 p.m. from the Staples Center in Los Angeles.
